Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for CDN usage, including expected traffic volume, geographic distribution, latency requirements, and security needs.
Choose the appropriate Azure CDN provider (e.g., Azure Front Door, Azure CDN Standard from Akamai, or Verizon) based on performance, cost, and feature requirements.
Plan the CDN architecture, including endpoint configurations, caching rules, and integration with existing applications and services.
Create and configure CDN endpoints in the Azure portal, specifying the origin server and caching policies.
Set up custom domains for the CDN endpoint, including SSL/TLS certificates for secure communication.
Enable security features such as HTTPS, Web Application Firewall (WAF), and DDoS protection to safeguard CDN traffic.
Define caching rules and policies to optimize content delivery and reduce latency for end users.
Perform testing to validate CDN performance, including load testing, latency measurements, and failover scenarios.
Set up monitoring and alerting for CDN performance metrics, such as cache hit ratio, bandwidth usage, and error rates.
Create detailed documentation of the CDN configuration, including endpoint settings, caching rules, and security measures.
Conduct training sessions for the operations team on managing and troubleshooting the CDN setup.
Ensure the CDN setup meets regulatory compliance requirements and implement regular auditing procedures.
